This function checks if the KillDriver effect should be applied, and, if so, applies it.

Parameters:
Bullet Pointer to the bullet
Returns:
true if the effect was applied, false if not
Author:
Renegade & AlexB
Date:
05.04.10
Todo:
This needs to be refactored to work with the generic warhead SW. I want to create a generic cellspread function first.

00295         if(!Bullet->Target || !this->KillDriver) {
00296                 return false;

00298                 // don't penetrate the Iron Curtain // typedef IronCurtain ChastityBelt
00299                 if(pTarget->IsIronCurtained()) {
00300                         return false;
00301                 }

00303                 TechnoTypeExt::ExtData* TargetTypeExt = TechnoTypeExt::ExtMap.Find(pTargetType);
00304 
00305                 // conditions: Warhead is KillDriver, target is Vehicle or Aircraft, but not protected and not a living being
00306                 if(((pTarget->WhatAmI() == abs_Unit) || (pTarget->WhatAmI() == abs_Aircraft))
00307                         && !(pTarget->BeingWarpedOut || TargetTypeExt->ProtectedDriver || pTargetType->Organic || pTargetType->Natural)) {
00308 
00309                         // if this aircraft is expected to dock to anything, don't allow killing its pilot
00310                         // (reason being: the game thinks you lost the aircraft that just turned, and assumes you have free aircraft space,
00311                         // allowing you to build more aircraft, for the docking spot that is still occupied by the previous plane.)
00312                         if(AircraftClass * pTargetAircraft = specific_cast<AircraftClass *>(pTarget)) { // relying on short-circuit evaluation here - nest this if necessary
00313                                 if(pTargetAircraft->Type->AirportBound || pTargetAircraft->Type->Dock.Count) {
00314                                         return false;
00315                                 }
00316                         }
00317 
00318                         // If this vehicle uses Operator=, we have to take care of actual "physical" drivers, rather than theoretical ones
00319                         FootClass *passenger = NULL;
00320                         if(TargetTypeExt->IsAPromiscuousWhoreAndLetsAnyoneRideIt && (passenger = pTarget->Passengers.RemoveFirstPassenger())) {
00321                                 // kill first passenger
00322                                 passenger->RegisterDestruction(Bullet->Owner);
00323                                 passenger->UnInit();
00324 
00325                         } else if(TargetTypeExt->Operator) {
00326                                 // kill first passenger of Operator= kind
00327

00329                                 PassengersClass worthlessOnes;
00330 
00331                                 // copy out worthless passengers until we find the driver cowardly hiding among them, then kill him
00332                                 while(pTarget->Passengers.FirstPassenger) {
00333                                         if(pTarget->Passengers.FirstPassenger->GetTechnoType() == TargetTypeExt->Operator) {
00334                                                 FootClass *passenger = pTarget->Passengers.RemoveFirstPassenger();
00335                                                 passenger->RegisterDestruction(Bullet->Owner);
00336                                                 passenger->UnInit();
00337                                                 break;
00338                                         }
00339                                         worthlessOnes.AddPassenger(pTarget->Passengers.RemoveFirstPassenger());
00340                                 }
00341 
00342                                 // copy the worthless scum back in
00343                                 while(worthlessOnes.FirstPassenger) {
00344                                         pTarget->Passengers.AddPassenger(worthlessOnes.RemoveFirstPassenger());
00345                                 }
00346                         }
00347 
00348                         // if passengers remain in the vehicle, operator-using or not, they should leave
00349                         if(pTarget->Passengers.NumPassengers) {
00350                                 TechnoExt::EjectPassengers(pTarget, -1);
00351                         }
00352 
00353                         // If this unit is driving under influence, we have to free it first

00355                                 if(CaptureManagerClass *MC = Controller->CaptureManager) {
00356                                         MC->FreeUnit(pTarget);
00357                                 }
00358                         }
00359 
00360                         // If this unit mind controls stuff, we should free the controllees, since they still belong to the previous owner
00361                         if(pTarget->CaptureManager) {
00362                                 pTarget->CaptureManager->FreeAll();

00364 
00365                         // BelongsToATeam()
00366                         // If this unit spawns stuff, we should kill the spawns, since they still belong to the previous owner
00367                         if(pTarget->SpawnManager) {
00368                                 pTarget->SpawnManager->KillNodes();
00369                                 pTarget->SpawnManager->Target = NULL;
00370                                 pTarget->SpawnManager->Destination = NULL;
00371                         }
00372 
00373                         // If this unit enslaves stuff, we should free the slaves, since they still belong to the previous owner
00374                         // <DCoder> SlaveManagerClass::Killed() sets the manager's Owner to NULL
00375                         // <Renegade> okay, does Killed() also destroy the slave manager, or just unlink it from the unit?

00377                         // <Renegade> so on principle, I could just re-link it?
00378                         // <DCoder> yes you can
00379                         if(SlaveManagerClass * pSlaveManager = pTarget->SlaveManager) {
00380                                 pSlaveManager->Killed(Bullet->Owner);
00381                                 pSlaveManager->ZeroOutSlaves();

00383                         }

00386                         pTarget->SetOwningHouse(HouseClass::FindByCountryIndex(HouseTypeClass::FindIndexOfName("Special")));

00388                         return true;
00389                 } else {
00390                         return false;
00391                 }
00392         }

bool WarheadTypeExt::WarheadTypeExt::ExtData::applyPermaMC ( CoordStruct *  coords,
HouseClass *  Owner,
ObjectClass *  Target 
)

This function checks if the passed warhead has MindControl.Permanent set, and, if so, applies the effect.

Note:
Moved here from hook BulletClass_Fire.
Parameters:
coords The coordinates of the warhead impact, the center of the Mind Control animation.
Owner Owner of the Mind Control effect, i.e. the one controlling the target afterwards.
Target Target of the Mind Control effect, i.e. the one being controlled by the owner afterwards.
Returns:
false if effect wasn't applied, true if it was. This is important for the chain of damage effects, as, in case of true, the target is now a friendly unit. 
00198                                                                                                     {
00199         if (this->MindControl_Permanent && Target) {
00200                 if (TechnoClass *pTarget = generic_cast<TechnoClass *>(Target)) {
00201                         TechnoTypeClass *pType = pTarget->GetTechnoType();
00202 
00203                         if (!pType || pType->ImmuneToPsionics) {
00204                                 return false; // should return 0 in hook
00205                         }
00206                         if (pTarget->MindControlledBy) {
00207                                 pTarget->MindControlledBy->CaptureManager->FreeUnit(pTarget);
00208                         }
00209                         pTarget->SetOwningHouse(Owner, 1);
00210                         pTarget->MindControlledByAUnit = 1;
00211                         pTarget->QueueMission(mission_Guard, 0);
00212 
00213                         CoordStruct XYZ = *coords;
00214                         XYZ.Z += pType->MindControlRingOffset;
00215 
00216                         AnimClass *MCAnim;
00217                         GAME_ALLOC(AnimClass, MCAnim, RulesClass::Instance->PermaControlledAnimationType, &XYZ);
00218                         AnimClass *oldMC = pTarget->MindControlRingAnim;
00219                         if (oldMC) {
00220                                 oldMC->UnInit();
00221                         }
00222                         pTarget->MindControlRingAnim = MCAnim;
00223                         MCAnim->SetOwnerObject(pTarget);
00224                         return true; // should return 0x469AA4 in hook
00225                 }
00226         }
00227         return false;
00228 }

void WarheadTypeExt::WarheadTypeExt::ExtData::LoadFromINIFile ( TT *  pThis,
CCINIClass *  pINI 
) [virtual] 

00038 {
00039         const char * section = pThis->ID;
00040 
00041         INI_EX exINI(pINI);
00042 
00043         if(!pINI->GetSection(section)) {
00044                 return;
00045         }
00046 
00047         // writing custom verses parser just because
00048         if(pINI->ReadString(section, "Verses", "", Ares::readBuffer, Ares::readLength)) {
00049                 int idx = 0;
00050                 for(char *cur = strtok(Ares::readBuffer, ","); cur; cur = strtok(NULL, ",")) {
00051                         this->Verses[idx].Parse(cur);
00052                         ++idx;
00053                         if(idx > 10) {
00054                                 break;
00055                         }
00056                 }
00057         }
00058 
00059         ArmorType::LoadForWarhead(pINI, pThis);
00060 
00061         if(pThis->MindControl) {
00062                 this->MindControl_Permanent = pINI->ReadBool(section, "MindControl.Permanent", this->MindControl_Permanent);
00063         }
00064 
00065         this->EMP_Duration = pINI->ReadInteger(section, "EMP.Duration", this->EMP_Duration);
00066         this->EMP_Cap = pINI->ReadInteger(section, "EMP.Cap", this->EMP_Cap);
00067 
00068         this->IC_Duration = pINI->ReadInteger(section, "IronCurtain.Duration", this->IC_Duration);
00069 
00070         if(pThis->Temporal) {
00071                 this->Temporal_WarpAway.Parse(&exINI, section, "Temporal.WarpAway");
00072         }
00073 
00074         this->DeployedDamage = pINI->ReadDouble(section, "Damage.Deployed", this->DeployedDamage);
00075 
00076         this->Ripple_Radius = pINI->ReadInteger(section, "Ripple.Radius", this->Ripple_Radius);
00077 
00078         this->AffectsEnemies = pINI->ReadBool(section, "AffectsEnemies", this->AffectsEnemies);
00079 
00080         this->InfDeathAnim.Parse(&exINI, section, "InfDeathAnim");
00081 
00082         this->KillDriver = pINI->ReadBool(section, "KillDriver", this->KillDriver);
00083 };
